page.title: 04HINXHILL ESTATE FARM 3
page.content: he dairy cows are milked twice a day. The milking machinery is advanced to that of other farms.The whole system is run by a computer.The farm has two tanks for storing milk.Each day 11,00 gallons of milk is collected from the farm.20 cows can be milked at a time while being fed.A unit is fitted onto the cows teats and the milk goes directly into tanks.The milk does not come into contact with the air so the risk of germs getting to it is 0.Above each cow is a digital metre which is linked to the computer.The machine is useful as it prints out information on the screen ie disease,special diets and breeding programmes, as well as the amount of milk taken from each animal. This is shown on the main computer and cuts out all paperwork.Meanwhile the cows are fed on potatoes and molases a sugar extraction.
